headline: Copart Q2 Earnings Miss Expectations, Revenues Decline Y/Y
summary: Copart Q2 EPS of 36 cents miss estimates as revenues fall 3.6% Y/Y to $1.12B, with operating income and net income down.

raw.headline: Copart Q2 Earnings Miss Expectations, Revenues Decline Y/Y
raw.summary: Copart Q2 EPS of 36 cents miss estimates as revenues fall 3.6% Y/Y to $1.12B, with operating income and net income down.

headline: How Copart’s Q2 Earnings Miss and Margin Squeeze Will Impact Copart (CPRT) Investors
summary: In February 2026, Copart, Inc. reported fiscal second-quarter results showing revenue of US$1.12 billion and net income of US$350.73 million, both down from the prior year and below analyst expectations, with diluted EPS easing to US$0.36 from US$0.40. Despite softer volumes and margin pressure, Copart highlighted record average selling prices for U.S. insurance consignors, a cash-rich balance sheet with about US$6.40 billion in liquidity and no debt, and ongoing share repurchases exceeding...
